introduccion.texto1: Del latín Uranus, de la traducción latina del griego antiguo representante del cielo y padre del dios Saturno.
introduccion.texto2: It is known for its extreme inclination, since its axis of rotation is inclined more than 90 degrees in relation to its orbital plane, which means that it appears to be rotating on its side.

lista.texto: PRESENCE OF WATER? → Yes, mostly ice.
COMPOSITION OF THE ATMOSPHERE → Hydrogen, helium, methane, water and ammonia.
Very faint ring system. It was discovered in 1977 by James L. Elliot, Edward W. Dunham and Douglas J. Mink.
Uranus has 27 known moons. The largest are TITANIA and OBERON, named after the fairy queen and king in Shakespeare's "A Midsummer Night's Dream".
Each of its moons has its own orbit and unique characteristics.
